meanings.definition: A person who tells lies or exaggerates.
meanings.sent1: That jiver always makes up stories to impress others.
meanings.sent2: The jiver claimed to have seen a UFO last night.
meanings.sent3: The jiver's tall tales always entertain us at parties.
meanings.sent4: Beware of the jiver's words, they may lead you astray.
meanings.sent5: The jiver's nose grew longer with each lie he told.

meanings.definition: To engage in playful or deceitful talk.
meanings.sent1: During the game, he would jiver to throw off his opponents.
meanings.sent2: She would often jiver with her friends to tease them.
meanings.sent3: The children would jiver about who could jump the highest.
meanings.sent4: He would jiver his way out of trouble with his smooth talking.
meanings.sent5: Her ability to jiver convincingly made her a great storyteller.

meanings.definition: A style of dance or music associated with jazz.
meanings.sent1: The energetic jiver dance moves lit up the stage.
meanings.sent2: The band played a lively jiver that got everyone on their feet.
meanings.sent3: The jiver music had a catchy beat that made people want to dance.
meanings.sent4: The jiver rhythm flowed through the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The jiver performance was a perfect blend of music and movement.
